channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
channel.desc: Sara Davies and Amy Dowden are purring through the North-East in a 1985 Ford Cortina, perusing antique shops and putting Sara's business knowledge to good use. Along for the ride are antique experts Natasha Raskin Sharp and Steven Moore.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC News
channel.desc: A comprehensive compilation of the latest and the most important news stories, updates and developments from the UK and different parts of the world.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Politics Live
channel.desc: Jo Coburn invites a panel of guests to share their opinions on the newsmaking stories of the day.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live Tennis: ATP & WTA Queen's 2025
channel.desc: Live coverage from the second round at Queen's Club as the leading male players aim to establish their grass-court credentials ahead of Wimbledon. A star-studded entry list for this tournament includes reigning Wimbledon champion Carlos Alcaraz and British hope Jack Draper, although it was at this stage that the top seeds began to fall in 2024, including Grigor Dimitrov, who was defeated by Sebastian Korda. Presented by Clare Balding.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
channel.desc: Kaye Adams, Alex Brooker, Kiell Smith-Bynoe and Isy Suttie take on a series of quizzes selected by Richard. A daily winner is declared at the end of each show, and the scores are tallied across the week to find an overall House of Champions winner.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
channel.desc: Robson is reunited with acting pal Mark Benton for a back-in-time weekend away. The pair leave the horsepower behind for an actual horse-drawn caravan as they pass through the back lanes of the Eden Valley.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Amol Rajan Interviews
channel.desc: Amol Rajan, the BBC's media editor, interviews the global, era-defining pioneers, leaders and maverick thinkers who are shaping the rapidly changing 21st-century world.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Lochs
channel.desc: Paul sails along a much-loved route through the Kyles of Bute to Dunoon, discovering a secret history of WW2 bouncing bombs along the way. From Dunoon and its connections with international singing star Harry Lauder, Paul gets nostalgic about nuclear submarines in the Holy Loch.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Saving Lives at Sea
channel.desc: In Whitby, the crew race to the rescue of two fossil hunters who are cut off by the tide. On Dorset's Jurassic Coast, in Swanage, a trainee yachtsman has suffered a mysterious head injury and is in need of urgent treatment.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Murder 24/7
channel.desc: Following teams of detectives and specialists involved in murder investigations.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Mortimer and Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
channel.desc: Paul, Bob, and Ted travel to Driffield Beck at Mulberry Whin in East Riding of Yorkshire to catch brown trout. They get started, but are slightly distracted by Ted, who is obsessed with rolling in the mud on the riverbank.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Newsnight
channel.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the day's top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC Weather
channel.desc: The latest weather forecast.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Unspun World with John Simpson
channel.desc: John Simpson brings his expertise to bear on the most important stories. In discussion with the BBC's range of experts across the world, he uses their unique local knowledge to go beyond the headlines to get to the unspun truth about the world.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Road Dance
channel.desc: A young girl lives in the Outer Hebrides in a small village in the years just before WWI. Isolated and hard by the shore, her life takes a dramatic change when a terrible tragedy befalls her.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
channel.desc: A moving work of art from the modernist home of architect Erno Goldfinger a pioneer of post-war high-density housing, undergoes conservation work, and hidden messages from an old master are discovered at Upton House.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Walking With Dinosaurs
channel.desc: Utah, 130 million years ago. A band of armoured dinosaurs battle to reach adulthood, pursued by some of the most formidable predators that have ever lived: Utahraptors. It's a deadly game of cat-and-mouse that pits heavy armour against vicious claws and lethal cunning; a life-and-death struggle that builds to a final showdown amongst the flames of a burning forest.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Jane Austen: Rise of a Genius
channel.desc: Determined to secure her financial future, Austen dives back into her writing.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Homes Under the Hammer
channel.desc: Martin is on the Jurassic Coast in Devon, but it's vampires, rather than dinosaurs, that he's dealing with, thanks to the interior-design tastes of the new owners of a one-bedroom flat.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Money for Nothing
channel.desc: Tigers in the night... sisters Katie and Sophie go 'big cat crazy' to save some chests!

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Gardeners' World
channel.desc: The team head to Birmingham for one of the highlights of the horticultural calendar - the annual Gardeners' World Live event.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC News
channel.desc: A comprehensive compilation of the latest and the most important news stories, updates and developments from the UK and different parts of the world.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Politics Live
channel.desc: Jo Coburn invites a panel of guests to share their opinions on the newsmaking stories of the day.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live Tennis: ATP & WTA Queen's 2025
channel.desc: The second round of the men's tournament continues at London's Queen's Club as the male contenders attempt to navigate a star-studded entry list. Carlos Alcaraz is among those hoping to do well at this tournament ahead of defending his Wimbledon title later this summer, but it was at this stage that he was knocked out of 2024's edition by British star Jack Draper. Clare Balding presents.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
channel.desc: Kaye Adams, Alex Brooker, Kiell Smith-Bynoe and Isy Suttie take on a series of quizzes selected by Richard. A daily winner is declared at the end of each show, and the scores are tallied across the week to find an overall House of Champions winner.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
channel.desc: Actor Denise Welch joins Robson for an escape to the Northumbrian countryside she still calls home. They take up paintbrushes in the stunning Allendale landscape and take to the saddle to immerse themselves in the region.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Great House Revival
channel.desc: Hugh Wallace is in Rockhouse, Co Cork, where school teacher Grace Cotter and her landscape gardener husband John are restoring what they think is a modest Georgian farmhouse.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: A Wild Year
channel.desc: As spring creeps in, the red grouse, unique to the British Isles, enjoy the young shoots of the heather that is almost all that can grow on the impervious sandstone of North Yorkshire's moorlands.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Heston: My Life with Bipolar
channel.desc: Following Heston Blumenthal in the aftermath of his diagnosis as he tries to understand the role bipolar played in his success and the impact it had on the people he loves. He also explores the state of bipolar care in the UK.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Marie-Antoinette
channel.desc: Marie Antoinette deals with personal grief when her daughter Sophie fails to thrive as she's blackmailed over stolen love letters to Fersen. But with political blows, the state of the economy.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Detectorists
channel.desc: Andy and Lance become eco-warriors when they find their beloved oak tree is due to be felled. But a 24-hour helpline turns out to be more of a hindrance. Andy stumbles upon treasure when, for once, he wasn't even looking.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Newsnight
channel.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the day's top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC Weather
channel.desc: The latest weather forecast.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Murder 24/7
channel.desc: A quiet estate in Shrewsbury is the scene of a horrific killing when 23-year-old delivery driver Aurman Singh is ambushed and fatally assaulted in broad daylight. West Mercia Police begin a major manhunt to track down his killers.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Murder 24/7
channel.desc: Following teams of detectives and specialists involved in murder investigations.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Great British Railway Journeys
channel.desc: Michael Portillo's rail exploration of the historic wooded region of south east England, known as the Weald, continues from Tonbridge, at the heart of the area's rail network. Michael also gets the lowdown on the Rother Valley Railway project.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Garden Rescue
channel.desc: Chris and Lee are in Bristol to transform Nicola's big and very bland garden. With one redeeming feature, a mature tree in its centre, they want a place where Nicola and son Luke can heal.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Money for Nothing
channel.desc: Woodworker Bruce has a plan. He has some wood, but can he create luxurious loungers from Jacqui's garden furniture bound for the skip?

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Anna Haugh's Big Irish Food Tour
channel.desc: Comedian Ed Byrne escapes to the Wicklow Mountains with Anna for a hike and a surprise meal. They spot sika deer in Glendalough and visit a farm producing halloumi-style cheese.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
channel.desc: In Sarajevo, capital of Bosnia, Michael Portillo traces the fateful last journey in 1914 of the Archduke Franz Ferdinand and his wife, Sophie, which ended in their assassination and led to the outbreak of the First World War.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC News
channel.desc: A comprehensive compilation of the latest and the most important news stories, updates and developments from the UK and different parts of the world.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Political Thinking with Nick Robinson
channel.desc: Nick Robinson has a conversation with, not an interrogation of, the people who shape our political thinking about what shaped theirs.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live Tennis: ATP & WTA Queen's 2025
channel.desc: Live coverage of the quarter-finals from London's Queen's Club as the leading men look to go deep into a tournament that will likely be their last before Wimbledon. Jack Draper is the big home hope heading into Queen's, but the quarter-finals proved to be a step too far in 2024. The British number one was unable to back-up his heroic victory against Carlos Alcaraz in the second round, instead falling to eventual champion Tommy Paul in three sets. Presented by Clare Balding.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
channel.desc: Kaye Adams, Alex Brooker, Kiell Smith-Bynoe and Isy Suttie take on a series of quizzes selected by Richard. A daily winner is declared at the end of each show, and the scores are tallied across the week to find an overall House of Champions winner.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
channel.desc: Robson is joined by his brother David and uncle Matheson for a two-day break on a canal boat. Taking a cross-country route, they marvel at the Ribblehead Viaduct and learn to navigate the Leeds-Liverpool canal during a downpour.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Test Cricket
channel.desc: Isa Guha presents comprehensive highlights from Headingley as England and India resume hostilities in the first Test of their five-match series. The two nations have a history of playing out thrilling Test contests, including the most recent meeting in England, which saw Ben Stokes's side complete the highest run chase in their Test history to salvage a two-all draw in a clash delayed over two years due to the Covid-19 pandemic.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Gardeners' World
channel.desc: It's almost summer solstice, the longest day of the year, and Frances Tophill is gardening at Damson Farm, a magical garden set in the glorious Somerset countryside.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
channel.desc: At Lanhydrock in Cornwall, a huge, 35-metre-long decorated ceiling needs saving. In Warwickshire, at the Tudor mansion Coughton Court, the very fabric of the building needs essential work.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Couples Therapy
channel.desc: Alison and Rod unpack their history of bickering; Jessica vents over her feelings for Boris; Mondo feels like a parent with his deaf partner Kyle; Nick and Katherine recount a revelatory trip that sent shock waves through their marriage.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Newsnight
channel.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the day's top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC Weather
channel.desc: The latest weather forecast.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert
channel.desc: Two drag queens and a transsexual are contracted to perform a drag show at a resort in Alice Springs, a town in the remote Australian desert. Travelling in their lavender bus, Priscilla, the road trip is anything but smooth.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Murder 24/7
channel.desc: With the suspected inside man arrested, detectives must prove he knew he was setting up a murder. A new investigation begins when a man tries to kill himself and his learning-disabled son.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Panorama
channel.desc: Millions of us enjoy the thrill of the funfair. But how safe are the rides we're getting on? Reporter Rahil Sheikh investigates.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Super Happy Magic Forest
channel.desc: The heroes are made to clean the Cave of Mirrors as punishment for frolicking before a quest is complete, and they accidentally release the Party Harpy.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
channel.desc: Grizzy pretends to have a twisted ankle so that the Lemmings have to take care of him.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
channel.desc: The Lemmings set up a mini fair, but Grizzy steals the Lemmings' tickets.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Pok?mon Horizons: The Series
channel.desc: On the way to Montenevera, Liko, Roy and Dot make a pit stop on snowy Glaseado Mountain.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Bro's in Control
channel.desc: Callum sends his Sharky mate to Joe and Adam's house with a request to paint his portrait. Find out if the boys can do it wearing glasses that make everything topsy turvy.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Operation Ouch!
channel.desc: We find out how muscles grow, and the doctors reveal five bizarre things your body can do!

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Blue Peter
channel.desc: BP heads to Trentham Monkey Forest to hang out with hundreds of Barbary macaques!

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Newsround
channel.desc: News magazine keeping young viewers up to date with the latest stories and events happening at home and abroad.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Gardeners' World
channel.desc: It's almost summer solstice, the longest day of the year, and Frances Tophill is gardening at Damson Farm, a magical garden set in the glorious Somerset countryside.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Earth's Wildest Waters: The Big Fish
channel.desc: The eight anglers embark on their first expedition to the wilderness of Iceland, where they brave extreme cold, wind and rain to fish in some of the most challenging conditions they have ever faced. In the Northwest, close to the Arctic Circle, the anglers fish from sea kayaks in the freezing fjord, before learning to harvest cod using a traditional Icelandic technique.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Best Dishes Ever
channel.desc: Ainsley Harriott celebrates dishes from across the Channel, getting inspiration from France, Italy and Spain. The menu includes the Greedy Italians' linguine, James Martin's Spanish sardines and a gorgeous chicken dish from Raymond Blanc.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live Tennis: ATP & WTA Queen's 2025
channel.desc: Clare Balding brings live semi-final action from the prestigious men's grass court event. Two-time defending Wimbledon champion Carlos Alcaraz begins the week as the man to beat. British number one Jack Draper is the only player to have got the better of Spain's Alcaraz on grass over the past two years, doing so in the second round at this tournament in 2024.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Flog It!
channel.desc: The Ulster Folk and Transport Museum in Northern Ireland hosts experts Thomas Plant and Caroline Hawley. Something out of the bags and boxes harks back to the era of traditional craftsmen. Paul Martin visits a family business that builds racing cars.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
channel.desc: At Lanhydrock in Cornwall, a huge, 35-metre-long decorated ceiling needs saving. In Warwickshire, at the Tudor mansion Coughton Court, the very fabric of the building needs essential work.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Great House Revival
channel.desc: Hugh Wallace visits returned Asset Manager Eoghan O'Riain who is restoring a former seaside guesthouse in his native Rathmullan, Co Donegal.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Test Cricket
channel.desc: Day two highlights from the first Test match between England and India.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Oasis at the BBC
channel.desc: A deep dive into the BBC's music archives for a celebration of Oasis, featuring such hits as Rock n' Roll Star, Cigarettes & Alcohol, Wonderwall, Slide Away and Champagne Supernova.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Oasis: Right Here, Right Now
channel.desc: Oasis discuss their recent career, revisit their old neighbourhood in Manchester, and perform songs from their album, `Be Here Now'.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Later ... with Jools Holland
channel.desc: Jools Holland introduces this studio concert from the Gallagher brothers. First broadcast 2000.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: A Bigger Splash
channel.desc: While vacationing on a Sicilian island with her boyfriend, a famous rock star receives an unexpected visit from an old flame and his seductive daughter, which creates a whirlwind of jealousy, passion and danger.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Weatherman Walking
channel.desc: Derek Brockway is in Pembrokeshire with its majestic cliffs, feeling what it is like to be exposed to the elements. He peeks at seal pups along the way, learns how to train a sheepdog, builds a stone wall and helps to create a unique sand circle.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Beechgrove Garden
channel.desc: The sweet taste of summer is being cultivated as Ruth delves into the strawberry patch that Carole started last year. The mix of plants was selected to make the plot productive all season long, and soon the early croppers will be ready for picking.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Landward
channel.desc: Dougie is in the Howe of Alford to meet a top Aberdeen Angus breeder, while Cammy attends a farm sale where a lifetime of machinery and tools are going under the auctioneer's hammer.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Farming Life
channel.desc: Spring arrives at last for the farmers, the busiest time of year for new lambs and calves. In the north, beyond Aberdeen, John is expecting more than 6,000 new lambs, so hires in extra staff to help. New Zealander Emma helps an ewe give birth to triplets, but will the smallest and weakest one survive?

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Battle of the River Plate
channel.desc: Allied forces chase the vessel all the way to South America, but after several failed attempts to sink the enemy ship, the Allies find themselves hatching a desperate and audacious plan.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: A Bridge Too Far
channel.desc: A re-creation of the fateful World War II battle for Arnhem, where the First Airborne Division parachuted into occupied Holland in 1944 as part of Operation Market Garden, an ambitious Allied plan to capture six Dutch bridges and cut off the Germans. However, certain events conspire to threaten the whole operation.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Race Across the World
channel.desc: Six months after undertaking the race of a lifetime, the five intrepid pairs meet for the first time since returning home. Together, they reflect on their race, which began at one of the wonders of the world, the Great Wall of China.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Flog It!
channel.desc: In Manchester, Caroline Hawley finds an autograph from one of rock and roll's biggest names and Anita Manning values a concertina. Paul Martin takes a journey through the city's musical history, from the Halle Orchestra to New Order and Oasis.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Greece with Simon Reeve
channel.desc: Simon Reeve travels from the Peloponnese peninsula to the rugged and mountainous north of the country. To learn more about Greece and the Greeks, he meets an extraordinary cast of characters, from a group of rebel monks to conservationists caring for an injured bear cub.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Test Cricket
channel.desc: Day three highlights from the first Test match between England and India.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Top Gear
channel.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May head to Vietnam to travel the entire length of the country in just eight days, thereby achieving what the American military failed to do in ten years. First they must each buy some suitable transport for the trip and, despite having several million Dong in their pockets, this proves to be rather more difficult than they thought.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Later ... with Jools Holland
channel.desc: With Rotherham's Self Esteem, singer and pianist Tom Odell, musical polymath Emma-Jean Thackray, Chicago's Ezra Furman and psychedelic songstress Greentea Peng. Also, Jools chats with Guy Garvey.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Walk the Line
channel.desc: Acclaimed biographical film of country music's legendary `man in black'. The film follows Cash from his childhood, where he was touched by tragedy, through his years on the road to his marriage to June Carter, who was country royalty, and their struggle to find happiness as she weans him off booze and drugs.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Moment of Proof
channel.desc: A jacket left behind in a stolen car carries the DNA to prove who was driving the vehicle. But it takes detective work to figure out who he is, and it turns out he is responsible for a series of car thefts and has been using fake number plates.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
channel.desc: Tasty treats from Ravinder Bhogal, Ollie Dabbous, Cynthia Shanmugalingam and William Curley. Meanwhile, Rick Stein and the Hairy Bikers head out and about across the UK and abroad.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Springwatch
channel.desc: The first week of wildlife is not over yet. As Springwatch heads into the weekend, there's a catch-up with the live cameras as the team gear up for fledgewatch.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC News
channel.desc: A comprehensive compilation of the latest and the most important news stories, updates and developments from the UK and different parts of the world.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Politics Live
channel.desc: Jo Coburn invites a panel of guests to share their opinions on the newsmaking stories of the day.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Edge
channel.desc: The game show that mixes general knowledge quizzing and bowling.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Lightning
channel.desc: Comedian Zoe Lyons presents the electrifyingly fast quiz with a ?3,000 jackpot. Six plucky contestants compete across six rounds testing their general knowledge, quick thinking and speedy reactions whilst our ruthless spotlight patrols the studio.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Unbeatable
channel.desc: Danika, Tim, Steven and Abi battle it out to see which one of them is unbeatable.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family
channel.desc: Leading criminal barristers Sasha Wass QC and Jeremy Dein QC investigate their first Scottish case, the murder of a reclusive pensioner nearly 70 years ago. Two men stood trial, but just one person was executed for the crime. Lanarkshire, 1952. On a Sunday in August, two men stopped to check on pensioner and hermit Michael Connelly, known affectionately as Old Mick, at his tiny ramshackle hut. Inside they found his dead body, beaten and bloody.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Flog It!
channel.desc: In Muncaster in Cumbria, hundreds of people turn up with collectibles and treasures they want to take to auction. Antiques experts James Lewis and Caroline Hawley uncover a few gems including a dazzling decanter and an art nouveau picture frame. Paul Martin visits Coniston Water in the Lake District.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
channel.desc: Former winners Mark Chapman, Will Kirk, Amanda Lamb and Rachel Parris take on a series of quizzes selected by Richard Osman. A daily winner is declared following a quickfire round at the end of each show, and the scores are tallied across the week.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
channel.desc: Robson invites acting friend Tessa Peake-Jones for a North York Moors weekend away. They take in the simple pleasures of a picnic in the Rosedale Valley, and at Abbey Farm, they make cheese and enjoy outdoor yoga with goats.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Test Cricket
channel.desc: Day four highlights from the first Test match between England and India.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Your Garden Made Perfect
channel.desc: Andrew and Paolo live in a new-build house in Liverpool. They have spent the past few years lovingly decorating their two-bedroom home into somewhere which reflects their quirky and retro design style.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Murder 24/7
channel.desc: Following teams of detectives and specialists involved in murder investigations.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Glastonbury
channel.desc: As the excitement builds for 2025's Glastonbury Festival, we celebrates some of the biggest hits of the 70s with unforgettable live performances from over the years on Worthy Farm.

channel.title: Newsnight
channel.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the day's top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC Weather
channel.desc: The latest weather forecast.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Couples Therapy
channel.desc: Kyle reveals the origins of his desire for sexual freedom; Boris and Jessica unravel their whirlwind trajectory; Alison tries a new tactic with Rod; Katherine and Nick throw a party that triggers a deep dive into Nick's relationship with his mother.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Race Across the World
channel.desc: Six months after undertaking the race of a lifetime, the five intrepid pairs meet for the first time since returning home. Together, they reflect on their race, which began at one of the wonders of the world, the Great Wall of China.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Antiques Roadshow
channel.desc: The roadshow visits Cromford Mills in Derbyshire, where experts dig up a garden gnome, a 100-year-old bar of chocolate, and a Picasso. Joanna Hardy is wowed by a collection of jewellery that epitomises the 60s and 70s.

channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Homes Under the Hammer
channel.desc: An aerospace engineer applies his design skills to property development in Derby, but are his skills complementary? Jacqui visits properties in Croydon and Great Yarmouth, where the new purchasers are hands on.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Bargain Hunt
channel.desc: Join Natasha Raskin Sharp for today's show in West Yorkshire. Experts Roo Irvine and David Harper lead the reds and blues as they battle it out at Wetherby Racecourse.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Extraordinary Portraits
channel.desc: Comedian and art lover Bill Bailey matches 20-year-old Millie, a campaigner challenging the stereotypes around Down's syndrome, with Karen Turner, an award-winning, self-taught painter. How will she portray this charismatic young campaigner?

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Alison Hammond's Big Weekend
channel.desc: Alison Hammond spends a big weekend with boxing world champion Tony Bellew. He reveals how he's coping with retirement and how boxing has taken a toll on his health.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Unbeatable
channel.desc: Gary, Nikki, Becky and Gavin battle it out to see which one of them is unbeatable.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family
channel.desc: Top criminal barristers Jeremy Dein QC and Sasha Wass QC re-examine their oldest case yet - the murder of a military veteran by his estranged wife nearly 200 years ago. Leicestershire, 1825. On the evening of 25 April, ex-soldier James Read was reported missing by his wife Hannah. A manhunt, spearheaded by Read's brother Thomas, found James's lifeless body in the Old Union Canal. As Hannah Read was the last person to see James alive, she became the prime suspect in connection with his death.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Flog It!
channel.desc: Some of the most interesting finds from the show's travels around the country, including the Milestones Museum in Basingstoke, Ragely Hall in Warwickshire, and the National Maritime Museum Cornwall in Falmouth.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
channel.desc: Former winners Mark Chapman, Will Kirk, Amanda Lamb and Rachel Parris take on a series of quizzes selected by Richard Osman. A daily winner is declared following a quickfire round at the end of each show, and the scores are tallied across the week.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
channel.desc: Celebrity chef Kenny Atkinson is Robson's guest at the picturesque border fishing village of St Abbs. Robson introduces Kenny to a local farm shop to gather ingredients for dinner before taking him on a wildlife watching boat trip.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Test Cricket
channel.desc: Day five highlights from the first Test match between England and India.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Digging for Britain
channel.desc: In central England, an RAF airbase with a Roman past, a forgotten medieval nunnery, a gold pendant from a 7th-century grave and a pub with a very long history of hospitality.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Murder 24/7
channel.desc: Following teams of detectives and specialists involved in murder investigations.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Glastonbury
channel.desc: With 2025's Glastonbury Festival fast approaching, this trip down memory lane relives the sound of the 80s, with incredible live performances of some of the biggest hits from the decade.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Newsnight
channel.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the day's top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC Weather
channel.desc: The latest weather forecast.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Surviving Syria's Prisons
channel.desc: They made thousands disappear. Now, the men who carried it out break their silence. In December 2024, the world witnessed the dramatic toppling of Syrian president Bashar al-Assad, ending a 13-year civil war.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Great British Railway Journeys
channel.desc: Michael Portillo's railway tour of the Weald reaches the spectacular Surrey countryside, where he finds a surprising connection to the darker reaches of the universe. Michael follows in the footsteps of Victorian ramblers who used the railway.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Bargain Hunt
channel.desc: In Leominster, Gary Pe gets a hero's welcome from the blue team, Llywelyn and Ollie. Meanwhile, Tim Weeks tries to bring order to a chaotic shop with friends Emily and Sophie.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Garden Rescue
channel.desc: Charlie Dimmock pays a visit back to Goring-by-Sea to look at a garden the team built six years ago. Its owners have continued to develop the garden, and Charlie is stunned to see it has been transformed into a beautiful coastal-themed haven.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
channel.desc: Sunny Somerset is the stage for a road trip with Amanda Barrie and Stephanie Beacham. They have experts Tim Medhurst and Serhat Ahmet to help spend ?400 wisely, and a 420 G Jaguar is their swanky classic car of choice.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC News
channel.desc: A comprehensive compilation of the latest and the most important news stories, updates and developments from the UK and different parts of the world.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Politics Live
channel.desc: Jo Coburn invites a panel of guests to share their opinions on the newsmaking stories of the day.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Edge
channel.desc: The game show that mixes general knowledge quizzing and bowling.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Lightning
channel.desc: Comedian Zoe Lyons presents the electrifyingly fast quiz with a ?3,000 jackpot. Six plucky contestants compete across six rounds testing their general knowledge, quick thinking and speedy reactions whilst our ruthless spotlight patrols the studio.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Unbeatable
channel.desc: John, Kelly, Aimee and Ricky battle it out to see which one of them is unbeatable.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family
channel.desc: Top criminal barristers Sasha Wass QC and Jeremy Dein QC re-examine an infamous case of a housewife accused of murdering her young husband. She became the last woman to be publicly hanged in Dorset, and her story inspired a legendary novel. Dorset, 1856. In the early hours of the 6th of July, Martha Brown, a resident of Birdsmoorgate in rural Dorset, called on her neighbour begging for help.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Flog It!
channel.desc: Paul Martin presents from Warwickshire's Ragley Hall, a 17th-century Palladian house. Antiques experts Christina Trevanion and Charlie Ross find a selection of antiques and collectibles to take to auction. Christina gets to grips with a weighty Jardinere, Charlie tests out a horse-measuring stick on its owner and Paul Martin steps into the world of folk art.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
channel.desc: Former winners Mark Chapman, Will Kirk, Amanda Lamb and Rachel Parris take on a series of quizzes selected by Richard Osman. A daily winner is declared following a quickfire round at the end of each show, and the scores are tallied across the week.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
channel.desc: Robson is joined by sporting legend Tanni Grey-Thompson in Northumberland's Kielder Forest. They share a bicycle ride on the shores of Kielder Water, and Tanni takes a leap outside of her comfort zone on an accessible zip wire course.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Great House Revival
channel.desc: A ruinous farmhouse and sheds in St. Mullins, County Carlow are lovingly brought back to life as a first home for a young couple.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: A Wild Year
channel.desc: It might be isolated, but Ramsey Island has enough attractions to ensure inhabitants stay here all year around, with seals to spot, surfing and plenty of sheep.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Saving Lives at Sea
channel.desc: The crew at Wick begin a frantic search to find a paddleboarder who has drifted a mile out to sea, while her family wait anxiously on the shore. Further south, the Fraserburgh crew respond to a mayday call from a trawler that has run aground.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Murder 24/7
channel.desc: After a brutal hammer attack in Telford, West Mercia Police have a 31-year-old man in custody. The man's attack on his family has left his mother dead. Detectives investigate his behaviour leading up to the attack.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Glastonbury
channel.desc: As the excitement for 2025's Glastonbury Festival reaches fever pitch, this is the ultimate 90s throwback, a look at some of the biggest hits from the decade performed over the years at Worthy Farm.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Newsnight
channel.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the day's top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC Weather
channel.desc: The latest weather forecast.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Unspun World with John Simpson
channel.desc: John Simpson brings his expertise to bear on the most important stories. In discussion with the BBC's range of experts across the world, he uses their unique local knowledge to go beyond the headlines to get to the unspun truth about the world.
